meanings.definition: Having a position in a hierarchy or scale
meanings.sent1: The top three students were ranked based on their test scores.
meanings.sent2: She was ranked as the best player on the team.
meanings.sent3: The cat ranked itself as the ruler of the house, sitting on the highest shelf.
meanings.sent4: In the world of birds, the eagle is ranked as the king of the sky.
meanings.sent5: The ranked list of countries by population made it easy to see which was the most populous.

meanings.definition: To assign a position in a hierarchy or scale
meanings.sent1: The judges ranked the dancers based on their performance.
meanings.sent2: I will rank the books on the shelf according to their genres.
meanings.sent3: The chef decided to rank the vegetables by color, creating a rainbow salad.
meanings.sent4: She ranked her favorite songs in a playlist, starting with the most loved.
meanings.sent5: The teacher ranked the students' projects from best to worst for the class to see.

meanings.definition: To be placed in a particular position in a hierarchy or scale
meanings.sent1: The new movie ranked high in the box office this weekend.
meanings.sent2: After the competition, she ranked first in the overall standings.
meanings.sent3: The cat managed to rank itself above the dog in the household hierarchy.
meanings.sent4: His dedication to his work ranked him among the top employees in the company.
meanings.sent5: The rare flower ranked among the most beautiful in the garden.
